intro: Byttneria campestris, commonly known as the African breadfruit, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that are encased in a fibrous husk. The fruit is edible when ripe and is used as a food source in some regions. It also has potential applications in traditional medicine and soil stabilization.
